subsection.name: Specifying the dependency in a CMS/Repository Application project
subsection.p: Add the following dependency in your CMS/Repository Application project. CMIS Replication Module depends on Hippo Repository Scheduler Module which has been available since Hippo CMS 7.8.3.
With the dependency addtion of CMIS Replication Module, an asset document replicated from CMIS Repository will have the following mixin type:
subsection.source: [cmisreplication:cmisdocument] mixin - cmisreplication:objectId (string) - cmisreplication:name (string) - cmisreplication:createdBy (string) - cmisreplication:creationDate (date) - cmisreplication:lastModifiedBy (string) - cmisreplication:lastModificationDate (date) - cmisreplication:versionLabel (string)
subsection.p: All the new property definitions with 'cmisreplication' prefix are for CMIS Document Metadata.

subsection.name: Configuring CMIS Replication Scheduler
subsection.p: By default, CMIS Replication Module becomes active by the Hippo Repository Daemon Module configuration at '/hippo:configuration/hippo:modules/cmisreplication-scheduler-module'. The daemon module initializes a CRON style scheduler task to replication CMIS documents to Hippo Repository, by using Hippo Repository Scheduler module based on the configured CRON expression.
Here are explanations on all the configurable properties:

tr.td:
CRON style Hippo Repository Scheduler configuration.
See Quartz CronTrigger Tutorial for detail on CRON expressions.
Flag whether the replication from source to target is on/off

Flag whether the replicated Hippo asset documents should be checked against the source CMIS documents to keep or remove the Hippo asset document. So, if a source CMIS document is deleted, then its corresponding Hippo asset document is removed as well.
The target Hippo Repository Asset Documents Path where documents are replicated to
The Repository ID of the CMIS Repository
The user name for CMIS Repository
The source CMIS Repository Document Path where documents are replicated from
The max number of items per batch for operations that return lists, passed to the org.apache.chemistry.opencmis.client.api.OperationContext.
